critique:
This executive order establishes an advisory committee on the public interest obligations of digital television broadcasters. It aims to explore how digital television can serve the public interest. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt. It doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on economic regulation by influencing broadcasting standards.

Initial scores:
*   Ideological Tilt: 0 (Centrist/Moderate)
*   Immigration Approach: 0 (Balanced/Selective)
*   Executive Power: 0 (Neutral/Balanced)
*   Federalism: 0 (Cooperative Balance)
*   National Security vs. Civil Liberties: 0 (Balanced Approach)
*   Economic Regulation: 1 (Slight Government Intervention)
*   Social Inclusion: 0 (Neutral)
